message_1: Let's consider the function f(x) = x + 2 in the type theory. If x has the type 'natural number', what is the resulting type of f(x)?
message_2: In type theory, if x has the type 'natural number', then the resulting type of f(x) = x + 2 will also be a 'natural number'. This is because adding a natural number (x) to another natural number (2) will always result in a natural number.
